results.title: Carousel
results.creator_credit: Henry King, Henry Ephron and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Gordon MacRae and Shirley Jones star in this musical fantasy about the miraculous powers of love. Filmed on location with beautiful seaside settings as a backdrop and a thrilling score for accompaniment, their romance unfolds. Gordon MacRae is Billy, a carnival worker who falls in love with Shirley Jones. Before the birth of their daughter, Billy is killed. Now years later, he returns to earth for one day to teach his daughter one very important lesson. A poetic and lyrical Rodgers and Hammerstein musical based on Ferenc Molnar’s play “Liliom”.

results.title: The Jolson Story
results.creator_credit: Alfred E. Green, Sidney Skolsky and Columbia
results.brief_description: An exuberant Hollywood biography of singer, Al Jolson. The film begins with Jolson’s life as the son of a poor cantor and traces his struggle to become America’s greatest entertainer. It features a great soundtrack of Jolson’s songs including “Mammy”, “April showers” and “You made me love you”. It received an Academy Award for Musical Score and Larry Parks was awarded the Best Actor Oscar for his portrayal of Jolson.

results.title: Dinner at eight
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, David O. Selznick and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Lionel Barrymore and Billie Burke play the Jordans, a shipping magnate and his wife, who are planning a dinner party and invite several interesting people. The complex plot gets underway as we get to know the invited guests and learn about their lives, their joys, their problems and their tragedies. Adapted from the play by George S. Kaufman and Edna Ferber.

results.title: Eureka stockade
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Leslie Norman, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: In 1854, the government instigated moves designed to drive the gold miners from Eureka Hill goldfields. The miners showed their opposition to the move by revolting. The legendary leader Peter Lalor is portrayed by Chips Rafferty. Cast includes: Peter Finch, Jane Barrett, Jack Lambert, Gordon Jackson.

results.title: The Searchers
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) resolves to find his niece, abducted by Indians at the close of the Civil War. It is an odyssey which takes five years, by the end of which he plans to take revenge on the Indians for the friends and family he has lost. John Ford used sumptuous Monument Valley as a background for this his most poetic and complex western. Stars Vera Miles and a young Natalie Wood. Based on a novel by Alan Le May.

results.title: The Manchurian Candidate
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Howard W. Koch, M.C. Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A brilliantly handled spy thriller! A Korean war ‘hero’ comes back a brainwashed zombie, triggered to kill a liberal politician… a human time bomb waiting to explode! Based on the novel by Richard Condon, this film stars Laurence Harvey and Angela Lansbury and Janet Leigh.

results.title: Il Mefistofele
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell and Valiant SRL Productions
results.brief_description: Il Mefistofele is Boito’s best-known work, an opera composed to his own libretto based on Goethe’s work. It was first performed in 1868. This world acclaimed production by Ken Russell, giving a modern interpretation to this opera, was first presented by the Genoese Opera and has toured widely throughout the world. (not subtitled)

results.title: 36 Fillette
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Emmanuel Schlumberger, Valerie Seydoux and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The title refers to a child’s dress size, which the film’s heroine, Lili, has unmistakably outgrown. A sullen, uncommunicative 14 year old vacationing with her family in Biarritz, Lili is clearly ready to strike out on her own. She does so by dressing up in jeans, a corset and a raincoat, then hitching a ride to the local nightclub in search of adventure. Not surprisingly, adventure comes her way! “36 Fillette”, written and directed by French novelist Catherine Breillat, is based on one of her novels.

results.title: King Kong
results.creator_credit: Merian C. Cooper and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: When King Kong, the eighth Wonder of the World and living god of fog-shrouded Skull Island, sets his passions on blonde beauty, Ann Darrow, all hell breaks loose. The enraged Kong battles a menagerie of prehistoric monsters, stomps jungle villages and chews up their inhabitants when Ann is snatched from his hairy paw. Captured and transported to New York, Kong breaks loose to wreak havoc on the Big Apple. The last scene atop the Empire State Building is one of the truly great moments in Hollywood history. Based on a story by Edgar Wallace.

results.title: Mrs Miniver
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Sidney A. Franklin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A multi Academy Award winning movie, Mrs. Miniver is an absorbing, emotional and even suspenseful drama of a family living in an English village and how they are touched and even brought to tragedy by World war II. The human element is the key to the appeal of Mrs. Miniver. The relationships, depicted with affection and wit are the basis of poignant, unforgettable drama. Stars Greer Garson and Walter Pidgeon, the most popular romantic team on the screen of the 1940’s and adapted from the best seller by Jan Struther.
